A1: uncertainties posed by drought in Brazil
RelatedSentence: Investing.com - U.S. coffee prices extended losses from the previous session on Monday , amid indications supplies might be on the rise despite uncertainties posed by drought in Brazil .

Brazil '' s official crop bureau Conab said last week that the nation 's new coffee crop is expected to total 44.57 million 60 - kg bags , down nearly 9 % from a January estimate due to drought conditions in key coffee - growing regions in Brazil .
The agency pegged Arabica production at 32.23 million bags and Robusta at 12.33 million bags .
Arabica is grown mainly in Latin America and brewed by specialty companies .
Prices of the sweetener lost 1.59 % on Friday to settle at $ 0.1791 a pound , as investors continued to monitor crop and weather conditions in top grower Brazil .
Prices of the sweetener lost 1.59 % on Friday to settle at $ 0.1791 a pound , as investors continued to monitor crop and weather conditions in top grower Brazil .

Brazil is the world '' s largest sugar producer and exporter , with the U.S. Department of Agriculture estimating the nation accounts for nearly 20 % of global production and 39 % of global sugar exports .
